pullRequest.body:
Prove that `IsIntegrallyClosed` is a local property, i.e., an integral domain `R` is integral closed if `Râ‚˜` is integral closed for any maximal ideal `m` of `R`.

Co-authored-by: Yongle Hu @mbkybky
Co-authored-by: Jiedong Jiang @jjdishere

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10882556074/job/30193842025)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10882556074/job/30193841747)

Thanks!

bors d+
`infer_instance` already finds this (it is `GCDMonoid.toIsIntegrallyClosed`).
In this file, `GCDMonoid.toIsIntegrallyClosed` has not been proven yet. But my theorem is a fundamental property of `IsIntegrallyClosed`, and I do not want to involve more content from other files.
OK, no problem. It is a `Prop` so no risk of diamonds. Maybe let's add a short about why it is needed.
Can you add a bit of documentation to the proof?
Is it possible to get `I` with current technology, ie without defining it explicitly?

> Is it possible to get `I` with current technology, ie without defining it explicitly?

I have changed the definition of `I` to `Ideal.span {x.2.1} / Ideal.span {x.1}`. This brought some technical difficulties regarding localization, so I have added several lemmas about localization.

```suggestion
              by simpa only [â† mk_eq_mk', â† hy] using by rfl
```
This seems very dubious.
We can maybe split some file, but `RingTheory.LocalProperties` looks like a reasonable "advanced" file to import integrally closed ring. Did you notice a serious slowdown?
No. I don't think so. But importing a specific local property into this file about local properties in general is a bad precedent. (Though not sure how much that has happened already.)
Ah, I see. I didn't think to that.

Sorry, I added the theorem `isIntegrallyClosed_ofLocalizationMaximal` in this file because I noticed that it already contains local properties such as `IsReduced`. It seems that letting the file `IntegrallyClosed.lean` import the file `LocalProperties.lean` is not an good choice either. So where would be the best place to put the theorem `isIntegrallyClosed_ofLocalizationMaximal`? Maybe we should split the section on local properties in general and the properties that satisfy local properties in `LocalProperties.lean` into separate files.

There is no need to apologize! That indeed is very sound logic. I think splitting out specific local properties out into individual files is a good idea. I would be happy to merge such a PR. 

Thanks for the contribution. This is a very important fact we were missing.

> There is no need to apologize! That indeed is very sound logic. I think splitting out specific local properties out into individual files is a good idea. I would be happy to merge such a PR.
> 
> Thanks for the contribution. This is a very important fact we were missing.

Thanks! I will split that file later.
See PR #16879

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(RingTheory/IntegralClosure/IntegrallyClosed): `IsIntegrallyClosed` is a local property
